website_summaries.verdict: A 12-pot coffee maker with exceptional features and beautiful looks. If you want a top model from the brand, this is the one to consider.
pros: With features like its built-in burr grinder, thermal carafe, coffee strength selector, 8-oz
bean hopper, and charcoal filter, it's not just an attractive, modern kitchen tool but one that makes great-tasting coffee
cons: The design of the spout could be improved – tends to dribble when pouring

customer_reviews.title: Makes a mess when pouring
customer_reviews.text: I like the looks and features. I hate the mess the carafe makes when pouring coffee. See the video. I don’t know if it is a flaw in mine or a poor design.
customer_reviews.author: JSH

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: The coffee grinder sits above the basket of grounds, causing all the steam to rise directly into the grinder. Every pot of coffee causes a wet, terrible mess in the grinder (which of course needs to be totally dry to start a new pot). After a couple of months I got tired of cleaning the grinder and resorted to buying g ground coffee. Also the grinder is small and I like strong coffee, so I can only make half a pot through the grinder. I’m posting some pics of the condensate left in the wet grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Private user

customer_reviews.title: Design Flaws aplenty
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited about buying this machine because of the grinder option. Unfortunately I am now returning it. I got 7 or 8 great pots of coffee out of it but then it started clogging up every time I tried to use the grinder despite thorough cleaning. I gave up trying to use beans and switched to ground coffee and now every single pot I make results in coffee and grounds leaking out all over my counter. I have tried making small pots, adjusting the filter basket, on and on all with the same result.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Cerminara

customer_reviews.title: Pour a Spill
customer_reviews.text: Love this coffee maker. Replaced an older model that definitely earned its keep. Two cons to this one: 1) Setting and operation of timer is not intuitive. You’ll need the manual to figure this out. 2) You simply can not pour a cup of coffee without spilling some. We’ve learned to pour over the sink but there is some design flaw in the spout.
customer_reviews.author: J. Aull

customer_reviews.title: The coffee made is excellent. Cons
customer_reviews.text: Nicest way to make fresh ground coffee. No longer have to clean up the mess from standalone burr grinders. The coffee made is excellent. Cons: The container that the ground coffee collects in, overflows some grounds, over the top edges of the paper basket filter into the coffee stream. Not much, but still annoying to have grounds in your last cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: wayneAZ

customer_reviews.title: Simple trick to make it last forever
customer_reviews.text: Great coffeemaker — especially for the price — and especially if you like your beans ground within seconds of brewing. Easy enough to clean; you just rinse it out and eco-minded environmental folks can just reuse the excellent filter it comes with. However, after a year of use, the part that turns the inner wheel to advance to grinding and then to brewing does wear out BUT it’s super simple to continue to use it after that. Just insert a penny on the corner that sticks out of the filter and cover. It’s an amazing trick and completely saves your machine.
customer_reviews.author: Eco-Minded

customer_reviews.title: What a nightmare
customer_reviews.text: For over ten years I was treated every monring to fresh ground coffee from my Capresso machine. I really thought a name brand like Cuisinart would be a safe bet. Instead it has this silly chute that constantly clogs up. Plus you get no warning. It might 5:40AM and suddenly you have to pour out all the beans and start sweeping grounds out with a little brush. To make it worse, you can't even brew ground coffee if it's in a snit about the clogged beans. Giving mine away to Goodwill.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Tatelman

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, needs more thought.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use coffee maker which makes great coffee. Grinds perfectly and the smell during grinding is fabulous. Your coffee is ground and hot water starts to flow. At this point, be careful you dont make a full pot or water will feel up in grounds and spills into the coffee pot seat. But dont clean up yet. When pouring your coffee into coffee cup, the less coffee in pot, the more it drips out coffee pot top. This is with two months of using this product. If you buy, enjoy the coffee but after you clean up the mess.
customer_reviews.author: dwcollectors

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy Owner
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker is great! Very easy to use, very easy to clean, and it's shown no signs of trouble after multiple uses every day. The grinder is quite loud so, if you're in a household with people on different work schedules, rest assured that it does a great job making preground coffee, too!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: It is amazing! The grind is always perfect and the speed ...
customer_reviews.text: I just unpacked this machine after 2-years of storage. It had been used for about 2-years before I had to pack it away while working overseas. Plugging it in and using it again reminded me of why I bought it in the first place and why I now give it a 5-star rating! It is amazing! The grind is always perfect and the speed of processing and taste of the fresh brew is amazing as well.
customer_reviews.author: FreelanceLife68

customer_reviews.title: Good but with one problem
customer_reviews.text: I have both this model and the one that has a regular glass carafe. They both make great coffee. The grinder is incredibly loud and unfortunately you can't pregrind the beans at night so you can quietly make coffee in the morning if other people are still asleep.The advantage of the insulated carafe is to keep the coffee warm without actually heating it. Unfortunately the insulated carafe leaks with every pour. It doesn't leak from the spout but rather from the edge where the metal meets the black plastic. It's not a deal breaker but it is a pain to have to clean up after every pour. I would recommend getting the basic model with the glass carafe.
customer_reviews.author: likes to hike

customer_reviews.title: Look for a different coffee maker!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this coffee maker for my husband and gave it fro him for Valentine’s Day. It worked 4 days and on the 5th day it wouldn’t brew. We have gone through the setup repeatedly and it still does not work. We have to pay the postage to mail it to cuisinart and include $10.00 in the package so they can mail it back to us.
customer_reviews.author: TLE

customer_reviews.title: Instructions omit a critical setup step.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Cuisinart grind and brew in ten years of daily use, and the first with the Directflow feature that greatly simplifies the bean grinding process. It's substantially quieter, somewhat quicker, and has a much easier to read display than my two previous coffee makers, DGB-900s. One major problem is the instruction manual makes no reference to the need to turn ON the on/off switch, and turn OFF the grind on/off switch, to program a) strength, and b) number of cups (quantity of coffee). The same steps must be followed before pressing BREW can begin.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: 3 years and still going strong
customer_reviews.text: We bought this in 2017 and it is still working great. Clean the coffee chute when the indicator says to clean it, and you should be good. Makes excellent coffee. Noisy, but, any grind and brew machine will be noisy. This is our second grind and brew machine. First one was a Capresso Coffee Team GS, which broke after almost exactly 5 years. Plastic parts just deteriorated and broke, making the machine useless. Although this Cuisinart seems to have more moving parts than the Capresso, it seems a bit more durable. Then again, it's only been 3 years. Anyhow... recommended.
customer_reviews.author: DALMN

customer_reviews.title: Most Appreciated...
customer_reviews.text: Amazon Service and Coffeemaker. The first unit we bought had a sensor problem right away. We called Amazon, they shipped out a new unit immediately and the Coffeemaker works like a charm. We put the other unit in the box and sent it back. We did have a Cuisinart with separate grinder and had coffee grinds everywhere from the grinder. The all in one concept is sound, the beans are on top, grinds, and brews delicious coffee (as long as you want 4 or more cups). We would highly recommend the DGB-800 Burr Grind & Brew Coffeemaker.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Tibbitts

customer_reviews.title: Dead after year and 3 months. Worthless 3 year warranty.
customer_reviews.text: Heating element died. Told I have to pay shipping both ways plus $10 handling fee for warranty repair and/or replacement. From central CA to warranty place in Arizona was $39 each way because it is very heavy. Not paying $90 to repair an appliance that only had a one year life span. Tossed it in the garbage this afternoon. Back to Mr. Coffee machines for me.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Caywood

customer_reviews.title: Worked flawlessly for 3 months. Then a downward spiral began.
customer_reviews.text: With repeated use the on/off switch becomes ultra sensitive, subject to inadvertently triggering premature shutdown with no way to resume operation. If you manage to get through a brew cycle, you will be left without the functionality of the hotplate. To add insult to injury, the manual is flawed in the instruction to set the "Automatic Shut Off" of the hotplate to "0:00" for continuous duty. In fact, this causes the hotplate to immediately shutdown after the brew cycle. If somehow you can overcome these flaws, it does brew a good cup of coffee, when it works.
customer_reviews.author: koolkatt

customer_reviews.title: Overall, pretty good coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker works well. The temperature is great and I like being able to adjust how long the warmer stays on. The controls are somewhat easy to figure out but tedious. As long as you don't need to change the start time too often, it's not a problem. My main complaint is that regardless of the number of cups I've programmed, the grinder seems to make grind the same amount - at least the cup looks about as full for anything over 8 cups. This machine makes good coffee. It's priced well for a mostly-automated system.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lent

customer_reviews.title: Issues with Fit/Finish Keep It from Making Coffee
customer_reviews.text: There is a nipple switch that is supposed to close when the filter basket arm is closed. You can feel it if you run your fingers over the surface just above where the filter basket would be if the arm was closed (arm must be swung open to do this). There is a little receiver at the top of the filter basket that is supposed to close the nipple switch. Because the fit is not perfect, the receiver does not push the switch enough and the pot stops making coffee (believing the basket arm is open). Once we figured it out, a small piece of tape over the receiver fixes the problem. We have to replace it every few days,.
customer_reviews.author: VincenT

customer_reviews.title: Do you like cold coffee.  If so, this is the coffee maker for you!
customer_reviews.text: Thermal carafe is supposed to keep your coffee piping hot. The only problem is its never hot to begin with just a mild warmth.
customer_reviews.author: A. Dancygier

customer_reviews.title: very coarse ground; uses lots of beans; would not buy again.
customer_reviews.text: We are still experimenting with settings, but the grind is very coarse. Currently we are reducing the amount of beans per pot and cut it in 1/2 without much effect of the taste of the coffee. The 12 cup setting uses about 4 oz of beans. We don't see much difference between the 3 strength settings. Gold basket works but it is much more convenient to use paper filters. We love the thermos pot. Would not buy again. Would buy a 'standard' coffee maker and a standalone grinder where we can control the grind.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. D.

customer_reviews.title: Warning: Poorly Made - Leaks Everywhere!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item as a Christmas gift for my spouse. They loved the whole bean storage and it's functionality. The coffee maker is very poorly made as it leaks everywhere from the bottom as well as the pot itself drips and leaks when you pour. We thought we might have got a bad coffee maker so we exchanged it for the exact same one. This didn't help as the same leaking and dripping still happened. This is so disappointing for this brand as we love all other Cuisinart products we have. This one is the pits and belongs in the trash!
customer_reviews.author: Derek E.

customer_reviews.title: ok...but not the best
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and must agree with the person who talks about the grinder! I had a grinder/brewer by cuisinart before, and loved it. The grinder was on the outside of the water compartment. The steam gets into the grinder area and makes for a very wet mess. The other part is that the grinder button is always on the and you have to remind yourself at 500 am to hit the button to turn it off!! Not a good idea... I like it well enough to keep it... but would not buy another one if and when this breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Travel guru

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS MACHINE!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this coffee maker. It has worked flawlessly since we have received it. Every morning I'm amazed by the magic of the conversion of whole beans into yummy amazing coffee. Note that everyone seems to complain about the arduous amount of maintenance this thing needs in order to function. Seriously, it takes like two minutes a day. I'm not kidding. It is not difficult to maintain this thing. I think those that complain are just plain lazy and should just get another coffee maker. Actually, I think they should just use coffee crystals and not worry about brewed coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B.

customer_reviews.title: Quality coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: it is so far so good. This grind and brew machine brews the coffee to be tasty and hot. the machine is not much noisy than other coffeemaker. the size of this machine is right size in our kitchen. all our family members are happy with this. One thing I concern is the grind part is wet; I think the hot steam comes into the grind part when water becomes hot, however, when I cleaned the part and grind the beans, it was okay, it is not big deal.
customer_reviews.author: sys

customer_reviews.title: So easy and it saves space.
customer_reviews.text: Just as awesome as I thought it would be. I’ve wanted to get this for several years and I finally splurged. It is really easy to set up and clean. It came with a gold tone filter so I didn’t need the one I ordered separately. Make sure you follow the instructions on prepping your filter. My first pot tasted funny, because I forgot to soak it before flushing it out. I would recommend doing 2 or 3 full pots of plain water to fully flush your filter and get the charcoal/ new plastic smell and taste out of the machine and not in your coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Romano

customer_reviews.title: Quality Issues, Diminished Standing
customer_reviews.text: The All in one construction is beautiful and takes the guesswork out of bean quantity. [Need lighter flavor, just add more water in the tank]. Simple operation. Simple Cleaning. The first unit shipped was faulty (stuck on clean mode). Yet I replaced it. Two prior purchases of different model Cuisinart coffee makers were BOTH faulty. They had a major design flaw. Conclusion is that Cuisinart products quality in construction and design has plummeted dramatically. This is likely due to poor - Off Shore construction and loose quality control. (?) At one time my mother would ONLY purchase Cuisinart products due to the Earned High Quality reputation. This is no long the circumstance today.
customer_reviews.author: 2xist

customer_reviews.title: Fancy but complicated,and waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Worse purchase from Amazon,I'm so disappointed because it grinds and brews coffee at the same time,this thing it's cheap. I got maybe 3-4 post of coffe out of this thing before the steam started clogging where the coffee in the grinder shoot before it actually makes it to the filter basket. This was not cheap and I really would exchange for a simple coffee maker as this is of no use to me,seeing it it doesn't work and I'm still out almost $90 and a coffee maker
customer_reviews.author: Yawdgurl

customer_reviews.title: It was like a new machine
customer_reviews.text: CLEANING GRINDER I was about to order a new one of these to replace my six year old unit because the grinder wasn't working well. As a last resort, before I placed the order, I poured almost boiling water directly into the grinder gear mechanism. Black, tar-like sludge oozed out.. I drained it in several positions and let it dry thoroughly before I plugged it back in and brewed a pot. It was like a new machine! The grinder now works flawlessly again. It seems the coffee even tastes better. I don't recommend this method as it might ruin your machine. Maybe I was lucky but I will do this periodically.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Durable and has great options
customer_reviews.text: I do love this coffee pot. It has settings from weak to strong so that it grinds the appropriate amount of beans. The coffee tastes good. It is programmable and easy to operate. If I were to point out something that I didn’t like, it seems that the coffee is not as hot as it could be. But I like very hot coffee. The opening to pour the water in is very narrow and awkward so I end up spilling some of the water sometimes. Neither one of these is a really big deal but there is room for improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Marla

customer_reviews.title: NICE Burr Grind Coffee Makes, FLAWED with a design or manufacturing problem.
customer_reviews.text: A Nice Automatic Burr Grinding coffee maker. Yes having the wonderful Burr Grinder makes a SUPERIOR cup of coffee, BUT yes, and of course, it needed to be clean about every 3rd or 4th use for that consistent GREAT coffee... ignor the instruction suggesting every 7-10 uses. Normally I would give the unit a 4 or 5 Star review. HOWEVER we've owned it for less than one year (arrived 10/18/18) and the grinder shoot door has stopped opening about every other use! This means unpluging it, re-cleaning the shoot and hoping it works! This is UNACCEPTABLE! I hope yo hear from Cuisinart will kindly reply back.
customer_reviews.author: c&ekessler

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffee, but confusing ergonomics
customer_reviews.text: I think this machine was designed by a committee., it is a real chore to use. none of the components seem to be designed to work as part of a team. For example: The lid on the carafe doesn't flip-up like a normal unit, you have figure out how to pull it off. You have to fiddle with the filter basket, it doesn't really seem to have a definite place to sit. Same with the grinder mechanism. Nothing seems to have any alignment path, you wiggle and turn each component to try to find where it goes. But when you finally get everything right, it does consistently make a great pot of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT WORTH THE MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: We used it daily and it made the best coffee until about 2 weeks ago. The machine started shutting off after brewing about 2 cups of coffee. I tried trouble shooting and doing everything that you tube, the book, and the internet told me to do. Nothing fixed it. I would truly like to return it so that I can get one that is dependable. HELP!
customer_reviews.author: Donna L.

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: I really like that this pot has a hopper and I don't need to fill the beans each use, but it isn't the easiest to clean. I have used other grind and brew pots before, and this is by far the easiest to clean though. The settings are a bit difficult to figure out. If I make 10 cups I need to put it on medium strength, but if I make 12 cups it has to be on light strength or it is to strong. Takes some trial and error to find the sweet spot.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah M.

customer_reviews.title: A great inexpensive grind and brew coffeemaker
customer_reviews.text: This is a great coffeemaker for the price! Yes, it requires a little bit of cleaning time. It's not an over-the-top or unreasonable amount of cleaning, however. The coffee tastes incredible - every morning. Yes, the grinder makes a noise. it is not super loud, like some of the reviews indicate. This machine is an excellent value and I look forward to a hot fresh cup of coffee from it every morning.
customer_reviews.author: CLINT E WATSON

customer_reviews.title: Returns are a pain in the A$$!
customer_reviews.text: I owned one many years ago that lasted about 2 years (honestly, because I didn't clean as well as I should have). A few years later (last month), I ordered another, but after only a few weeks, stopped working (the filter basket would not close all the way). The seller was unable to return (thanks, or not, to Amazon), so I called Cust Svc and they dissed me to the Manufacturer! The manufacturer was able to resolve but will take 2-3 weeks!
customer_reviews.author: J. T. Roe

customer_reviews.title: Filter chamber design issue (update)
customer_reviews.text: A significant amount of vapor comes out from the gap at the top of filter basket door during brewing and causes condensation partially seen on the attached picture. The included permanent gold tone filter is being used and the filter basket door is properly closed, so this appears to be a design issue. Update: spoke to Cuisinart customer service and was told that little vapor escape is normal. I do not know how much is "little", but I believe any vapor escape is lowering the effectiveness of coffeemaker, so good bye Cuisinart, returning the item.
customer_reviews.author: maestro

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again, love it.
customer_reviews.text: Love this coffee maker. It is easy to use and so far simple to clean just a quick rinse. The only down side it that the grinder can be loud but it is only for a minute so if you have kids you might want to brew only when they are awake or turn the grinder off and use preground beans. Love the pot it really is a no spill. I also love that it will keep warm for 4 hours which i great when you are running around cleaning all day. The coffee is always very hot, and i do use creamer and have to wait a little to take my first sip. So far I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee maker with a little work.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. The unit makes a great cup of coffee. The only thing I find a little annoying is, I have to clean the trap door where the ground coffee goes into the filter. If this is not cleaned out after every pot, the grinder can not push the grounds through to the filter. It will become clogged. I have developed a quick routine that makes the set up easier, but this is simply an engineering issue that could be fixed with a little critical thinking. Seriously though, the coffee that this unit makes tastes great and the thermal carafe keeps the coffee hot for more than an hour and a half.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Just get one ...
customer_reviews.text: Look, I have read reviews where people criticize the loudness of the machine or the difficulty in cleaning these. I replaced an older model with this as the old one had served us well (10+ years) and this one is stainless so it goes well in the new kitchen. The thing grinds the coffee so if you are surprised by the noise, what did you expect? Also, it is a little tricky to clean - a few parts - but the taste of the coffee it brews far outweighs these minor issues in my humble opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Vehec

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Unlike the last Grind and Brew we had from Cuisinart, this one in easy to clean! Makes good coffee. My only complaint is that you cannot decide on a water to coffee ratio. Yes, you can set it to strong, but once you put in a certain amount of water, it determines how much beans to grind. I'm okay with that, but my husband like more control about the ratio. Love that it uses a insulated craft, which is very good at keeping the coffee hot without lose of flavor. Definitely would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MML in SC

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well
customer_reviews.text: We have had problems from the beginning. Specifically, we cannot get it to brew immediately, either with whole beans or ground coffee because we keep getting an "empty basket" error. We prefer to use a reusable filter, which we rinse & clean as much as possible, but continue to get the error. We tried using disposable filters but still get the error. For some reason when programmed to start later it doesn't happen. And as everyone else has pointed out, the grinder is very loud. I sleep a floor above and it wakes me every time. It's like someone using a leaf blower in the room below. It was so expensive it's frustrating that it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: KLK

customer_reviews.title: How can this NOT include a way to turn the coffee maker back on to reheat the pot???
customer_reviews.text: I am 51 years old and have NEVER purchased a coffee maker that I am not able to turn back on after it shuts off (4 hours max for this one) so that I can reheat the coffee in the carafe. Just because of this, low rating. We are a couple that likes to "nurse" our coffee all day, so this WILL NOT work for us. Unbelievably frustrated and unhappy with this purchase. Otherwise it's fine in the first 5 months of use, but this reheat feature is CRITICAL for us. Cuisinart, you disappoint us!
customer_reviews.author: DK1968

customer_reviews.title: Love This Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this coffee maker. It's easy to set up. easy to clean, and makes excellent coffee. I like strong coffee, and this machine delivers! Set for 8 cups, I usually put 9 cups of water in the reservoir to keep it from being too strong. The direct path from the hopper to the filter basket means beans flow well, even with darker oilier coffee beans. Mad props to the team at Cuisinart. The materials are high quality, and the design is well thought-out and well executed.
customer_reviews.author: Greg R

customer_reviews.title: My Most Used Kitchen Appliance
customer_reviews.text: This is a great coffee machine. I’ve had it for about six months so far, and it’s held up great with regular use (5-10x/week). Though it isn’t marketed as a single serve machine, I still use it to make just enough coffee (24 oz) to fill my travel mugs. The only reason that I deducted a star is because the other reviews are right - the carafe does occasionally drip when pouring, but it isn’t a lot, and it doesn’t really take away from the overall functionality of the machine.
customer_reviews.author: jjackson131

customer_reviews.title: compact with grinder
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for a smaller size of coffee maker with grinder which fits my narrow bar counter. I guess Grinder cup is up to 8cups because lid doesn't fit if you put more than 8cups so you have to use grounded coffee when you make more coffee, but it's OK to me. Cleaning is bit tricky. Most parts are able to separated but water tank is not detachable, so you can't wash it. Also you have to keep opening top after use to dry out water tank, otherwise water tank might get moldy.
customer_reviews.author: katie

customer_reviews.title: Makes the freshest coffee ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is actually a replacement for an identical item that after many years of use finally wore out. I like the fact that you can use whole beans. Instead of putting in measured ground coffee and water, you put in whole beans, and then the pot grinds them and brews it. You can't get any fresher than that!
customer_reviews.author: NancyK

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffee
customer_reviews.text: I've had Cuisinart blade grinders in the past but this is my first burr grinder. I couldn't believe the difference in the flavor of the coffee! Grinding via burr really seems to release a lot more of the bean. I also found that I can use less beans for the amount of coffee that I am making. For example, if I'm brewing a full pot-12 cups-I use the 10 cup setting and the coffee still is plenty strong. The only question I have is how long will the burr will keep grinding before it wears out.
customer_reviews.author: kaipod

customer_reviews.title: Smart enough to be annoying, Dumb enough to drive you crazy.
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker (under the right conditions) make a good pot of coffee. But it can drive you crazy very quickly. It has a few smart features like auto off, and timer, but is dumb enough and easily mistake prone to drive you insane. If the user makes one mistake on cleaning or putting it back together you end up with a flooded counter. The pot it self if not poured into the cup very slow, will create a mess. The pot will auto off in a few hours, that can be good, but is often too soon for me. Its not the worst pot, and definitively not the best.
customer_reviews.author: Cisco Fan

customer_reviews.title: It used to be a good Pot
customer_reviews.text: If you love weak coffee that has no taste then this is the pot for you. I had this coffeemaker years ago in white and it made really good coffee,but I dont know what they have done to it. The water doesnt go over the grounds,it must be defective, but its too late to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: lighthousedk

customer_reviews.title: It is ok
customer_reviews.text: It's an ok coffee maker, nothing special. It does make good coffee but a pain to program the timer. Also, each night I doublecheck the timer and lately have used ground coffee rather than the beans. The last several mornings the machine has ground beans even though I hit the NO GRIND button. We live near a USAF base and this morning I thought a plane crashed near out house but it was the coffee pot grinder. I would not purchase again and will return this one.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: NOT AS GREAT AS I THOUGHT
customer_reviews.text: I like Cuisinart products, thus like having the brand across my countertop. What I don't like about this coffee maker with built-in grinder is the amount of cleanup necessary to prepare the machine for next use. The interior compartment retains a lot of moisture, and that accumulates in the bean grinder, thus, it needs to be thoroughly washed, and dried, before the next use. Likewise, the coffee filter area needs a good washout after each use.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Nothing beats coffee made with fresh beans ground immediately with every pot of coffee!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 6th Cuisinart Grind & Brew since 1994. Twice I replaced because the grinder broke, once just because I wanted the thermal carafe then once to go back to glass carafe that makes up to 12 cups rather than only 10. The last time I bought a new grinder blade unit that still didn’t work so I assumed it to be the grinder motor. Rather than mess with having that fixed and, since it was five years old, I opted to buy a new unit. Yes, I can grind my own beans but nothing beats coffee made with fresh ground beans ground immediately with every pot of coffee!
customer_reviews.author: Peggy (McGregory) Berry

customer_reviews.title: Great machine. Brings real Starbucks taste home. Has intelligence builtin
customer_reviews.text: I used to go to Starbucks for regular coffee every single day for 15 years. One day I realized I need to save those times going to Starbucks. After many trial-and-error, I landed on this. I buy the Starbucks beans and grind in this to bring the real taste. I would say this gives me a more consistent taste than even what we get in Starbucks. This machine also has some basic intelligence built-in. For example, if I forgot to clean the filer, it would remind me. Remember to clean the Chut regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Ravi N

customer_reviews.title: An awful, awful product. Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: This product is so bad I’ll be seeking to return it. The clock gains time (I’m talking it ran itself 30 minutes forward every couple of days). The grinder runs when it’s *specifically* set *not* to. The carafe itself leaks like a sieve every time you try to pour a cup. And, worst of all, the coffee is BITTER no matter what brand or amount of coffee you put in and no matter how you set the brew strength.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High maintenance
customer_reviews.text: Overall it works well and coffee tastes good, but it’s time consuming to take out the the components and wash them everyday- the compartment for the beans fills with steam, makes a mess, drips ‘coffee water’ all over when you remove it. .. I’ve only owned it a couple months so I can’t vouch for its durability
customer_reviews.author: ro

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Worst coffeemaker I’ve ever had. The condensation when it brews gets into the top and makes the coffee grinder wet which means coffee beans/grounds stick to it next time if it’s not completely dried. And I have to use double the amount of coffee beans than regular or my coffee comes out looking like water. I’m annoyed that we didn’t use this coffeemaker until after the return window had closed, because it would definitely be going back if I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Banfi

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Just now writing a review, purchased this in 2012 and still love it. Lol! I love that this gives you fresh coffee from fresh grounds. I prepare it the night before and it grinds the beans and brews in the morning for me. Sometimes you need to clean out the grinder from the oily beans. But it’s easy enough to do. Also just wanted to share that I still love this pot and it’s still going strong after 8 years of daily use.
customer_reviews.author: S. Holland

customer_reviews.title: The Specs are Wrong!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Cuisinart DGB-900BC Grind & Brew coffee maker as a surprise Father's Day gift for my husband. When I set it up the night before Father's Day so he would see it the next morning, I discovered it is NOT the 15.86" tall as it was stated in the product statistics. Instead it is just a bit less than 16.5" tall. Consequently it does not fit between my counter top and the top cabinets. Unfortunately, there is no other place to put a coffee maker in my kitchen. I am seriously considering returning this coffee maker. This is not only a hassle, but a big disappointment for Father's Day.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Henry

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee but a hassle to clean
customer_reviews.text: Like mentioned by other reviewers it is annoying to clean. If the grinder was shut out somehow from the pot so the steam doesn’t go into it... it would be pretty awesome. But unfortunately you have to clean the grinder every time either after for before you make coffee. Also it’s annoying because even though it has a “grind off” button, you can’t use the machine unless it has the grinder in it. Very dumb. We just keep the lid of the grinder on to keep it from beeping at us. Otherwise the coffee it makes is great!
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Second one I found. No derogatory remarks.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I've owned. Price point is reasonable as I got 5 years out of the last unit. I don't have anything bad to say about it. If you're thinking about grinding your own, very convenient to just put in water and hit the button. You'll be really surprised at the taste difference, especially if you find the companies here on Amazon you don't roast the coffee until the order has been placed. Go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed since the grounds compartment has a gap
customer_reviews.text: it's a great coffee maker but the one that we received this time has a slight gap in the door on the front has not caused the same problems and actually allows the steam to escape through the front so we'll see how long it lasts hopefully he's not gets this who knows maybe they'll send us another one.... as you can see on the left in the picture it's nice and tight on the right there is about a eighth to quarter inch gap
customer_reviews.author: Rich Swain

customer_reviews.title: Grinder Poor Design!! Weak Coffee!!
customer_reviews.text: Design for cleanup is the best I have seen in a coffeemaker. It makes extremely rich flavorful coffee. The problem is the grinder all the way around. The grinder makes extremely weak coffee. There’s no adjustment from course to fine. It’s just weak. The other features are fabulous and works great. I just couldn’t see spending that type of money on coffee maker that I couldn’t use the grinder.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT MAKE GOOD COFFEE, REGARDLESS OF BEAN TYPE/BRAND
customer_reviews.text: Makes inferior coffee, regardless of bean type/brand or water. We learned a long time ago that coffee made with freshly ground beans is typically more flavorful than using regular grounds. Had a Capresso 10 yrs ago that ground the beans, then made the coffee, and it made extraordinary coffee. Thought we would try this Cuisinart with thermal carafe...........we used filtered water, high quality beans, and this coffee maker did not produce coffee as good as k-cups. Furthermore, it is a pain to clean..............and REALLY loud! Very disappointed. We have gone back to K-cups & drinking better coffee........we will try to return the Cuisinart coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: L. K.

customer_reviews.title: WOULD BUY AGAIN.
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT. KIDS EVEN LIKE GRINDING AND MAKING COFFEE FOR ME. After 2 months still love this machine. If coffee starts to get bitter clean chute going to basket. Also added small paper filter to basket really helped taste n easier to clean. Can just dump paper filter n clean screen once a week. So easy to grind now and tastes like your favorite commercial vendor with the right bean. Big box bean even tastes good.
customer_reviews.author: Gregario

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart Grind & Brew DGB-800 12 cup coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this item many times over the last 20 years. This edition with the 12 cup model never worked properly. Obviously this model was produced way differently than previous grind and brews. The burr grinder ground through all coffee beans in the hopper regardless of the strength or cup setting. It never worked! This model is awkward because of it’s height, now it will not fit on my counter below the upper cabinets. I will not buy this again. I am cured of my Grind & Brew addiction. I now have a separate grinder and use a simple coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Loyal Reader

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for about six months now - I enjoy the reduction in daily prep to make coffee in terms of grinding or measuring out grounds. You do have to clean out the shute from the grinder to the basket about once a week, but it's pretty easy. Only drawback is that the grinder is kind of loud, but I think that is unavoidable. On the bright side it also functions as an alarm if you use the timer/auto-start function.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: My favorite coffee pot for making fresh ground coffee from whole beans, which I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I like fresh ground coffee and the convenience of buying whole beans and letting the machine to the work. I have tried "De Longhi" machines and have been disappointed to say the least. They break and are not durable. This machine is going on 2 years, makes great coffee, and is easy to clean. I also like the Carafe which keeps the coffee warm for hours without burning it like a warmer does. Pros Carafe Takes Whole Beans Easy to clean Charcoal filter in water reservoir to filter water Cons Wish it held more beans
customer_reviews.author: James Francis

customer_reviews.title: I love this Coffee Maker!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best Grind & Brew coffee maker I have found! I love the thermal carafe which keeps coffee hot for a couple of hours without a hot plate which is awesome. In fact, this is the second one I have purchased as I put my "old" one in our camper. It still works great after 8 years of reliable service. I was surprised it is still available and must be a testament to how well it works and how many people love it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Maines

customer_reviews.title: Warm fresh coffee
customer_reviews.text: We love the brew and grind technology but realize it is an evolving product. We've had 3 Cuisinart versions and the previous two were okay but eventually broke down. This time though, the problem had nothing to do with the brewing or grinding, but that it never got hot enough. It still brewed coffee, but warm fresh coffee is not the best. We tried it for 2 months, paid the restocking fee to return it, and will go to a local retailer. We had the option of paying to ship it back to Cuisinart to get a replacement, but saw too many reviews saying the same thing we experienced.
customer_reviews.author: Wisco CPA

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: This coffee pot is horrible. We had two with the same issue. The first one beeped about cleaning the basket from the moment we plugged it in. It only worked properly one time. Second one arrived and had no basket, so we went and bought one. It worked for three mornings before we got the basket cleaning error again. We cleaned up and boxed up the second one to return and when we got to the UPS store it leaked water everywhere destroying the box we were trying to ship it in. It must have been holding the water in a secret compartment. Anyhow buy a different coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Lorien Walker

customer_reviews.title: Stops grinding
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this November 2017, 4 months later it stopped grinding, I called and they send me another one, and I was asked to send it by regular mail, I took to post office it cost me $57.00 to have it ship back. So the new one that I have had for about 5 months this morning it stopped grinding. It's not worth having to ship it back.
customer_reviews.author: Daphnie - @Bound By Book Review

customer_reviews.title: $150 mistake
customer_reviews.text: The carafe that came with the coffee maker is terrible because all the coffee can't be poured from it due to its design. I mean you can turn it completely upside down and still be left with about half a cup left in the carafe. I finally decided to replace the thermal carafe with a glass one only to find out the thermal plate shuts down after brewing allowing for just one pour of hot coffee. Otherwise the unit is just fine, but the issue I describe is a big deal to me.
customer_reviews.author: James D

customer_reviews.title: Best combo ever.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter and her husband as an early Christmas gift. The one they had was returned twice and continued to have issues with it starting. I saw there frustration with the other one. Since I gave this to them they are constantly telling how much they like it. Set the timer and it will grind and start brewing before there alarm goes off. They are now smiling in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Vikkilo

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a year now. The good news is that it's still working. I thought this would make much better coffee, but after trying many different kinds, I'm just not impressed. This thing is also Loud. Maybe a little softer than turning on a shop vac when it's grinding beans. And about the grinding, the chute constantly gets clogged and it requires heavy maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: Gunner McParson

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: This is our third Grind and Brew coffeemaker. Yes, it is a pain to clean, but we love the taste of the coffee from freshly ground coffee beans. It is loud when grinding the beans, but we do not mind that. We clean our coffee maker thoroughly, plus change the charcoal filter and use a vinegar rinse every 6 months. That keeps this amazing coffee maker pouring out the best tasting coffee ever!
customer_reviews.author: Florida Girl

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do it
customer_reviews.text: At first this machine was great - despite having to clean the basket, basket holder, two pieces that fit over basket, screw top for the thermal pot, and the thermal pot itself after every use. However, you also have to clean the chute where ground beans will compact and block it. Despite following the cleaning instructions to the letter the machine became inconsistent with the amount of coffee being placed in the filter. This obviously results in very weak coffee and a waste of beans. Buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi

customer_reviews.title: Grounds get stuck in delivery tube every time! Inconsistent amount of grounds each time.
customer_reviews.text: Does not deliver a consistent amount of grounds to the basket. About 1/2 to 2 grams of coffee grounds get stuck in the horizontal delivery tube every time beans are ground, regardless of strength setting or number of cups setting or how clean the tube is at the start. That means you also WASTE that much coffee every time. Also, if you try to make a full 12 cups, you will often get overflow from the reusable basket so that grounds go INTO the carafe. Cleaning the horizontal delivery tube of grounds is a real pain too. DO NOT BUY THIS MODEL.
customer_reviews.author: Beth St Amand

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea, But Too Hard to Use
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this product so badly. Being a coffee lover, I've found that grinding the beans right before I brew gives me the best taste. I bought this machine to save me a step in the morning. I loved the idea of waking up to freshly brewed coffee from freshly ground beans. Unfortunately, I could only get it to brew the largest # of cups no matter how many times I tried. The results were very watered down cups of coffee. Unfortunately, I'll have to return it. I'm searching again. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: GizzleDawg

customer_reviews.title: Worst coffee maker I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker barely keeps the coffee warm and hardly grinds the beans. It's the weakest cup of coffee I've ever had. When I contacted amazon about this, they told me to open up the bottom of the coffee machine to see if there was a thermostat. They then connected me to Cuisinart who told me I voided the warranty when I opened up the bottom of the machine. It's ridiculous. I will never buy a Cuisinart item again after how rude they were on the phone. Amazon is replacing the item for me, but I'm pretty sure it's just going to be the exact same problem with the next one.
customer_reviews.author: David Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee maker with a design issue
customer_reviews.text: Overall - a good coffee maker that brews consistent and flavorful coffee. Relatively easy to clean and coffee bean holds good amount of coffee (enough beans for 4-5 days (8 cups)). Drawback - The spout design produces infuriating experiences when pouring coffee into your cup each morning as its dribbles on the side onto the floor/counter. Have to pour my cup over the kitchen sink everyday! If they fixed this - its a definitely a 5 star product.
customer_reviews.author: newsman

customer_reviews.title: Too complicated
customer_reviews.text: I like this coffee machine but it’s too complicated to operate. There are a couple weird quirks (clean button flashes and no way to turn it off, coffee basket is full so system tells you to ‘empty’ it - but I can’t, I need to make coffee). It frustrates people because it’s not intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: Jody

customer_reviews.title: Not well designed
customer_reviews.text: Annoying that you have to measure out the exact amount of beans & water each time you want to make coffee. The steam from the coffee rises into the grinder, making a gross mess. I had to clean it thoroughly between each pot, let it dry, then put it back together, otherwise the grinder was too clogged up. Didn't work without a paper filter, either; there were massive amounts of grounds at the bottom of my cup.
customer_reviews.author: Krista Galauxy

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee every morning!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this product in October 2018 and this machine works just as well as it did on day 1. It is a machine that you have to clean regularly (about once a week). To ensure everything works properly, once the bean holder runs low or empty, we'll take the top portion off and clean the inside of the grinder area with the brush that's provided. To ensure we rememberd how to do this in the beginning, we left the sticker on top of the unit.
customer_reviews.author: The MC's

customer_reviews.title: ... same coffee maker because I just can't find a better one! The first one last exactly 3 years ...
customer_reviews.text: Second time purchasing the same coffee maker because I just can't find a better one! The first one last exactly 3 years (not bad for a relatively cheap grinder/maker combo). Holds plenty of beans and makes good coffee. My only complaint is having to clean out the grinder portion (small, tight space) but it needs to be done to run properly! I clean it out after every emptying of the bean holder. Once you get used to fresh ground coffee there's no going back! Thermal carafe keeps coffee warm for a really long time. Now if they would only make one attached to a water line!
customer_reviews.author: Erin Rix

customer_reviews.title: Eh, it’s probably ok.
customer_reviews.text: The first one we received from Amazon did not brew after it ground the coffee. Amazon supper was great in terms of wanting to help. In the end , Cuisinart ended u sending a replacement but their process was slow. It took almost a month from purchase on Amazon to receiving the replacement direct from Cuisinart. We are still getting the hang of making good coffee with it. Programming it is easy. I think it will be a good addition to our appliances but it’s too soon to tell.
customer_reviews.author: A. Fitch

customer_reviews.title: Best value for money
customer_reviews.text: I've been researching a grind and brew coffee makers for a while. I was considering this machine and the one from Breville. Finally got this one. It is a great coffee maker. Set it up before going to bed and program to make coffee before you wake up. It does require regular cleaning - but that is understood to be done with any grind and brew system. Overall we are very happy with the coffee machine and recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Max M.

customer_reviews.title: Makes a delicious brew.
customer_reviews.text: I had the model with the blade grinder for several years, while it was a lot of work for clean up, it worked great. Eventually the motor on the grinder began to wear out (usually bearing going bad). So I decided to go to this more advanced model. It works great, much easier to clean and I love being able to control the strength of my brew (I like mine very strong). It works as I had hoped. If you've never used a thermal carafe then you just have to get use to the way it pours, otherwise I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin E. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Leaky and two many parts
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible product. Six things to clean after each use. Ok. I was ready. Made my first pot of coffee. 8 cups of water. Check. Right amount of beans. Check. Turned it on and noticed water leaking from bottom of pot. Only five cups of coffee came out. Guess 3 cups are on the counter. And did any reviews or product description note that heating element only stays on for 20 minutes and that a thermal pot for coffee is recommended?
customer_reviews.author: T. Novak

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This Burr Grind and Brew coffeemaker is a nice step up from my previous Cuisinart. I like the coffee strength selector; I especially like its ease of cleaning which is much simpler than my old coffeemaker. I like the storage compartment above. My only quibble is that the smallest amount you can brew is 4 cups. I would have liked a two or three cup option. All in all, a top notch coffeemaker.
customer_reviews.author: J. Vandegriff

customer_reviews.title: We love this!
customer_reviews.text: I just received one for our second home because we have loved this machine. Really, I don't know what the problem is with cleaning. I rinse the grinder, basket and carafe in the morning, using my dish brush. Then I use a Scotch Brite Stay Clean Scrubber on the grinder and "chute" to get the stuff out, then leave it to dry. Takes seconds.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: My favorite coffee machine yet!
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a fresh ground coffee maker. No longer a fan of my Keurig. I was at my cousins home & she had this. Became obsessed! The pour spout of the mug isn't the greatest & tends to make a mess as well as the water tank doesn't save any water if you fill it to the top. It will use all the water you pour in for that brew instead of only using what you need. Those would be my only two complaints. I recommend taking everything out & cleaning it after every use. Love the idea of freshly ground coffee beans. Also, you can set a timer so you can wake up to freshly made coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Carissa Worcester

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: The last one I had lasted 10, maybe 15 years. I was surprised to see it was still made, but happy to order the same model as a replacement. I will admit the first one I had lasted less than a year and had to be replaced. Butt the replacement lasted at least 10 years with no issues. The only real downside is that you have to clean the hopper, or you will have issues and it will stop working until you clean it. Tip: Its easier to clean on a regular basis than to tackle a major cleaning after it clogs up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great at first.
customer_reviews.text: If I would have given this review when I purchased the machine 6 months ago, I would have given it 5 stars. However, about a month ago, the machine has been clogging constantly. We cannot use the grid and brew feature because when the beans grind, the machine clogs. We have even used our vacuum cleaner to clean out the grinds. But, it still clogs. We are now grinding our beans with a separate grinder and then using the grind off brewing. It’s disappointing because we are not getting the coffee maker that we expected.
customer_reviews.author: unlisted

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: I just love this coffee maker! I've used a few different ones but I really appreciate that this one does it all and the coffee takes better too! I got tired of all the steps I was doing to make my coffee--grinder, kettle, French press, etc. Just push a button or program it to start automatically and it does it all. Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Miguel M.

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good - great if you want STRONG coffee
customer_reviews.text: Decent machine, no real issues so far. Started on medium strong 12 cup grind. Backed up to weak ten cup. Basket still very nearly full of grounds. Backed up to six. Well over half full, still strong. Now on weak four and about right. (Note: The tiny pic above this review request shows the thermal carafe. Mine isn't thermal.)
customer_reviews.author: J. H. Haley

customer_reviews.title: Do Not buy this.
customer_reviews.text: It's been close to 2 months since I bought this product. Initially it was working fantastic. But recently every other day it is having some or the other trouble. We had one before this for years & this can't even stand 2 months. The grinder is horrible, it doesn't grind all the beans. The ground coffee doesn't pass through the metal filter properly & the filter will pop open randomly while it's brewing. Making alot of mess. Honestly, I will like to return this useless coffee machine. It's more of a headache.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle user

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product. Cuisinart CS is a joke !
customer_reviews.text: This is my second unit of this model #. First one lasted 2 years which is ok, I guess. Went to buy parts for it, Cuisi website said they were obsolete. Forced to buy a new one, thing broke after 3 months. Two components broke this time! Called CS, was basically told I could wipe my derrière with the warranty I purchased. Finally got them to agree to send me a replacement. Replacement has been on back order going on 6 weeks now.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S

customer_reviews.title: Grounds in the coffee every time.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this coffee machine, but I end up with grounds in my coffee every single time. The problem seems to be the way the grounds are sprayed into the basket. Instead of just dropping them straight down into the filter, they go EVERYWHERE. The grounds always make their way around the filter, whether I use a paper filter, gold filter, or both.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Mixed bag
customer_reviews.text: Like having grinder as part of coffee machine. I don’t mind the addition cleaning I have to do since I chose a bean grinding coffee maker. I like the coffee pot’s no spill pouring but don’t like the inability to pour the last few oz. of coffee out of the pot. The provided “Gold” filter leaks too many grinds. The strength settings are too weak which I have to adjust by using less water then the number of cups I set it to.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri Bennett
